Package edu.ou.cs2334.project4.models

Class NonogramMakerModel

java.lang.Object
edu.ou.cs2334.project4.models.NonogramMakerModel
public class NonogramMakerModel extends Object
This class handles all of the back-end logic and processes need to store, update, open, and save the Nonogram
Author:
Blake Lee

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    NonogramMakerModel(int numRows, int numCols)
    Constructor that creates a NonogramMakerModel object with the specified amount of rows and columns Throws an IllegalArgumentException if either parameter is not greater than 0
    NonogramMakerModel(File file)
    Constructor that creates a NonogramMakerModel object with the given text file Reads data according to the format given in the project example
    NonogramMakerModel(String filename)
    Constructor that creates a NonogramMakerModel object with the given string, representing the name of a File containing initialization data.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    getCell(int rowIdx, int colIdx)
    Returns the boolean value of the Nonogram location given (True = Filled In, False = Empty)
    boolean[]
    getGrid()
    Returns a copy of the boolean grid representing Nonogram values where true represents a filled in value and false is an empty value
    int
    getNumCols()
    Returns the Nonogram puzzle's number of columns
    int
    getNumRows()
    Returns the Nonogram puzzle's number of rows
    static List<Integer>
    project(boolean[] cells)
    Returns a list of Integers representing the configuration of the 1D boolean array passed to it in the format described in the project example where numbers represent groups of cells and separate numbers means there is a gap in between those groups
    List<Integer>
    projectCol(int colIdx)
    Constructs an array of the desired column and uses this class's project method to return a list of Integers representing the groups and configuration of the column
    List<Integer>
    projectRow(int rowIdx)
    Constructs an array of the desired row and uses this class's project method to return a list of Integers representing the groups and configuration of the row
    void
    saveToFile(String filename)
    Uses this class's toString() method to save the Nonogram to a text file with the name passed to this method as "filename"
    void
    setCell(int rowIdx, int colIdx, boolean state)
    Sets the specific cell given by index values to the value given by state
    String
    toString()
    Returns a String representing the Nonogram's data, including the Nonogram's number of rows and columns, followed by the projection of each row and column(respectively), then shows each row of the Nonogram and its data where a 1 represents a filled cell and a 0 represents an empty cell

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • NonogramMakerModel

      public NonogramMakerModel(int numRows, int numCols)
      Constructor that creates a NonogramMakerModel object with the specified amount of rows and columns Throws an IllegalArgumentException if either parameter is not greater than 0
      Parameters:
      numRows - Number of Desired Rows in Nonogram, Must be greater than 0
      numCols - Number of Desired Columns in Nonogram, Must be greater than 0

    • NonogramMakerModel

      public NonogramMakerModel(File file) throws FileNotFoundException
      Constructor that creates a NonogramMakerModel object with the given text file Reads data according to the format given in the project example
      Parameters:
      file - Text file that contains data needed for the initialization of the Nonogram
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the file passed to the constructor does not exist or is not accessible

    • NonogramMakerModel

      public NonogramMakerModel(String filename) throws FileNotFoundException
      Constructor that creates a NonogramMakerModel object with the given string, representing the name of a File containing initialization data. Reads data according to the format given in the project example
      Parameters:
      filename - String representing name of text file that contains data needed for the initialization of the Nonogram
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the file name passed to the constructor does not reference a valid file

  • Method Details

    • getGrid

      public boolean[] getGrid()
      Returns a copy of the boolean grid representing Nonogram values where true represents a filled in value and false is an empty value
      Returns:
      boolean grid representing Nonogram values in format described in description

    • getCell

      public boolean getCell(int rowIdx, int colIdx)
      Returns the boolean value of the Nonogram location given (True = Filled In, False = Empty)
      Parameters:
      rowIdx - Index of Row for desired cell
      colIdx - Index of Column for desired cell
      Returns:
      Value of Nonogram cell at location given

    • setCell

      public void setCell(int rowIdx, int colIdx, boolean state)
      Sets the specific cell given by index values to the value given by state
      Parameters:
      rowIdx - Index of Row for desired cell
      colIdx - Index of Column for desired cell
      state - New state of desired cell (True = Filled In, False = Empty)

    • getNumRows

      public int getNumRows()
      Returns the Nonogram puzzle's number of rows
      Returns:
      Number of rows in Nonogram

    • getNumCols

      public int getNumCols()
      Returns the Nonogram puzzle's number of columns
      Returns:
      Number of columns in Nonogram

    • project

      public static List<Integer> project(boolean[] cells)
      Returns a list of Integers representing the configuration of the 1D boolean array passed to it in the format described in the project example where numbers represent groups of cells and separate numbers means there is a gap in between those groups
      Returns:
      List of results from array of cells given that holds number/group value from left to right or top to bottom

    • projectRow

      public List<Integer> projectRow(int rowIdx)
      Constructs an array of the desired row and uses this class's project method to return a list of Integers representing the groups and configuration of the row
      Parameters:
      rowIdx - indicates the row desired to be projected and returned
      Returns:
      List of results from row given that holds number/group value from left to right or top to bottom
      See Also:
      • "project" class for explanation of number meaning

    • projectCol

      public List<Integer> projectCol(int colIdx)
      Constructs an array of the desired column and uses this class's project method to return a list of Integers representing the groups and configuration of the column
      Parameters:
      colIdx - indicates the column desired to be projected and returned
      Returns:
      List of results from column given that holds number/group value from left to right or top to bottom
      See Also:
      • "project" class for explanation of number meaning

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile(String filename) throws IOException
      Uses this class's toString() method to save the Nonogram to a text file with the name passed to this method as "filename"
      Parameters:
      filename - : Name of the text file desired to be created and save Nonogram data
      Throws:
      IOException - If the filename can not be opened or created for any reason
      See Also:
      • class's toString() method for explanation on how data is stored

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a String representing the Nonogram's data, including the Nonogram's number of rows and columns, followed by the projection of each row and column(respectively), then shows each row of the Nonogram and its data where a 1 represents a filled cell and a 0 represents an empty cell
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
